_88AssertionConsumerServiceBinding.info: Select the binding the SP claims support for. A binding specifies the technical method of a connection.

_88NameIDFormat.info: This indicates whether the nameID is set to something random or the same every time the user logs in. Use transient if user does not need to be identified in a new session.

___^mdui:PrivacyStatementURL:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the Privacy Statement of the service.

___^AssertionConsumerService:([0-9]{1}):.info: An Assertion Consumer Service (or ACS) is the location at a ServiceProvider that accepts <samlp:Response> messages. With the index you can include additional <md:AssertionConsumerService> elements in the SAML 2.0 SP metadata with the same binding, each with its own unique index.

___^coin:ss:type_of_service:(en|nl)$.info: The type of service used in the facet search in dashboard.

___^contacts:([0-3]{1}):contactType$.info: From the pull down, select the type of contact.

___^contacts:([0-3]{1}):surName$.info: The surname of the contact. e.g. for 'John Doe', 'Doe' is the surname.

$eref.info: This indicates whether the nameID is set to something random or the same every time the user logs in. Use transient if user does not need to be identified in a new session.

___^NameIDFormats:([0-2]{1})$.info: The format in which the service expects the response. This can be transient, transparant or unspecified.

___^contacts:([0-3]{1}):isSirtfiSecurity.info: Set the security contact for this service.

___^OrganizationURL:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the website of the service e.g. http://www.example-service.nl/en/.

___^coin:entity_categories:([1-4]{1})$.info: Select one of the entity categories applicable to this service. Entity Categories group federation entities that share common criteria.

___^contacts:([0-3]{1}):emailAddress$.info: The e-mail address; syntax in accordance with RFC 5322. e.g. m.l.vermeegen@university.example.org.

___^name:(en|nl)$.info: Set the name of the service. Format: 'Service Name | Supplier'

___^AssertionConsumerService:([0-9]{1}):.info: An Assertion Consumer Service (or ACS) is the location at a ServiceProvider that accepts <samlp:Response> messages. A typical ACS location for an SP might look like this: https://data.example-service.nl/saml/saml2_acs/

___^contacts:([0-3]{1}):givenName$.info: The given name of the contact. e.g. for 'John Doe', 'John' is the given name.

$eref.info: Select the binding the SP claims support for. A binding specifies the technical method of a connection.

___^AssertionConsumerService:([0-9]{1}):.info: An Assertion Consumer Service (or ACS) the location at a ServiceProvider that accepts <samlp:Response> messages. The type of binding for this location can be selected from the pull-down.

___^mdrpi:RegistrationPolicy:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the Registration Policy of the service.

___^url:(en|nl)$.info: The URL to the support site of the service.

___^OrganizationDisplayName:(en|nl)$.info: The friendly name of the organization. e.g. University of Harderwijk.

___^contacts:([0-3]{1}):telephoneNumber$.info: The telephone number of the contact.

___^OrganizationName:(en|nl)$.info: The formal name of the organization. e.g. Service by University of Harderwijk.

___^coin:ss:wiki_url:(en|nl)$.info: Add the URL to the SURF wiki for additional information of this service.

___mdrpi:RegistrationInfo.info: The name of the authority that can register a service provider or identity provider.

___coin:privacy:certification_valid_to.info: The date until the Third Party Memorandum (TPM) is valid.

___coin:privacy:surfmarket_dpa_agreement.info: Is the SURFmarket model Data Processing Agreement (DPA) signed by the service provider?

___coin:privacy:privacy_policy_url.info: The URL to the applicable privacy policy.

___SingleLogoutService_Binding.info: SingleLogoutService is not supported by the Engine Block. Selects the SingleLogoutService binding an SP claims support for. A binding specifies the protocol to access the service.

___coin:trusted_proxy.info: Set if the service provider can act on behalf of connected services to this service.

___coin:policy_enforcement_decision_requ.info: Set to activate the user policy engine (PDP).

___coin:privacy:sn_dpa_why_not.info: Explains why the SP answered no on the subject of the SURFmarket DPA.

___coin:original_metadata_url.info: The provided URL to the metadata of the service.

___coin:additional_logging.info: Set to get an extended form of logging.

___coin:privacy:gdpr_is_in_wiki.info: Set if the 'General Data Protection Regulation' (GDPR) is available on the SURF wiki. In Dutch known as 'Algemene Verordening Gegevensbescherming' (AVG).

___coin:privacy:certification_valid_from.info: The date from which the Third Party Memorandum (TPM) is valid.

___coin:ss:idp_visible_only.info: Set to make invisible in the dashboard for institutions that are not connected to this service.

___coin:ss:aansluitovereenkomst_refused.info: Set to indicate the service in the dashboard for institutions is marked as to have disagreed to sign the aansluitovereenkomst.

___coin:privacy:certification_location.info: Where can customers find the mentioned certificates or how can they request access.

___coin:privacy:security_measures.info: Explains what security measures are taken to protect data. You can also link to a page describing this.

$eref.info: This indicates whether the nameID is set to something random or the same every time the user logs in. Use transient if user does not need to be identified in a new session.

___coin:application_url.info: The URL of the service used to log on.

___coin:privacy:privacy_policy.info: Does the SP publish an applicable privacy policy on a web page?

___coin:ss:license_status.info: Set the applicable license for this service as provisioned by the SP Dashboard.

___coin:signature_method.info: Select the Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA) as used by the service provider.

___coin:publish_in_edugain_date.info: When to add metadata to the eduGAIN feed. Usually the current time.

___logo:0:height.info: The height of the logo found at logo:0:url in pixels.

___coin:privacy:other_info.info: Other data privacy and security information that helps the institution decide whether it is OK to connect the service.

___coin:do_not_add_attribute_aliases.info: Only send the SAML 2.0 name scheme.

___coin:institution_guid.info: This is a 128 bit number also known as a globally unique identifier (GUID or UUID) for this service.

___coin:privacy:what_data.info: Explain in a sufficient level of detail what (types of) data, so not just attributes, are processed within the service.

___coin:eula.info: The URL to the end-user license agreement (EULA) of the service provider.

___coin:privacy:certification.info: Can a Third Party Memorandum (TPM) be supplied? e.g. ISO27001/2, ISAE3402, etc.

___coin:publish_in_edugain.info: Set this for service providers published in eduGAIN.

___logo:0:url.info: Enter the URL to the logo used for this service. e.g. https://static.example-logo.nl/media/sp/logo.png.

___coin:service_team_id.info: Enter the team name as used in the SP Dashboard. e.g. urn:collab:group:example-teams.nl:nl:surfnet:services:spd_example.

___coin:transparant_issuer.info: Set this to let the Engineblock use the EntityID of the IdP in stead of the EntityID of the Engineblock.

___coin:stepup:requireloa.info: Set to require Stepup Authentication for this SP with the specified minimum Level of Assurance.

___coin:no_consent_required.info: Select this option to skip the consent for a user.

___coin:interfed_source.info: Must be set if the federation source is either eduGAIN or Entree.

___coin:contractual_base.info: Set the contractual base that underlies a production SP / RP entity.

___logo:0:width.info: The width of the logo found at logo:0:url in pixels.

___redirect.sign.info: Whether authentication request, logout requests and logout responses should be signed. The default is FALSE. This is generally set for trusted proxies like OpenID Connect Gateway.

___coin:privacy:access_data.info: Explain what people or roles at which companies can access data, and if necessary to which extend.

___coin:display_unconnected_idps_wayf.info: Display unconnected IdPs in the WAYF.

___coin:privacy:surfnet_dpa_agreement.info: Is the SURFnet model Data Processing Agreement (DPA) signed by the service provider?

___coin:stepup:allow_no_token.info: When Stepup Authentication is required for this SP, allow users without a registered token to log in regardless.

___SingleLogoutService_Location.info: SingleLogoutService is not supported by the Engine Block. If the connected SP supports SAML 2.0 Single Logout, this will specify the endpoint element as a URL.

___coin:privacy:country.info: In what country or countries does the data reside; include both primary processing location(s) as well as for instance locations where backups live.
